info.title: CrowdTangle API
info.description: The CrowdTangle API can be used to access posts, the leaderboard and the link-checker.

get.summary: Retrieve a set of posts for the given parameters.

parameters.name: accounts
parameters.description: The account handles or platform ids to search. These can be separated by commas to include multiple accounts.

parameters.name: brandedContent
parameters.description: Limits to or excludes posts that have been marked as Branded Content, either as Publisher or Marketer.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of posts to return.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The latest date at which a post could be posted. Time zone is UTC. Format is “yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss” or “yyyy-mm-dd” (defaults to time 00:00:00).

parameters.name: includeHistory
parameters.description: Includes timestep data for growth of each post returned.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Exceptions: Some languages require more than two characters: Chinese (Simplified) is zh-CN and Chinese (Traditional) is zh-TW.

parameters.name: listIds
parameters.description: The IDs of lists or saved searches to retrieve. These can be separated by commas to include multiple lists.

parameters.name: minInteractions
parameters.description: If set, will exclude posts with total interactions below this threshold.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of posts to offset (generally used for pagination). Pagination links will also be provided in the response.

parameters.name: pageAdminTopCountry
parameters.description: Limits to posts for which the account has the pageAdminTopCountry matching the parameter setting.

parameters.name: searchTerm
parameters.description: Returns only posts that match this search term. Terms AND automatically. Separate with commas for OR, use quotes for phrases. E.g. CrowdTangle API -> AND. CrowdTangle, API -> OR. CrowdTangle API -> AND in that exact order. You can also use traditional Boolean search with this parameter.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: The method by which to filter and order posts.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The earliest date at which a post could be posted. Time zone is UTC. Format is “yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss” or “yyyy-mm-dd” (defaults to time 00:00:00). This must be before endDate. Timeframe and startDate are mutually exclusive; if both are passed, startDate will be preferred.

parameters.name: timeframe
parameters.description: The interval of time to consider from the endDate. Timeframe and startDate are mutually exclusive; if both are passed, startDate will be preferred. Depending on the number of posts, longer timeframes may not return within the timeout window. If you get a 504, try shortening your timeframe.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: The types of post to include. These can be separated by commas to include multiple types. If you want all live videos (whether currently or formerly live), be sure to include both live_video and live_video_complete. The "video" type does not mean all videos, it refers to videos that aren't native_video or youtube (e.g. a video on Vimeo).

parameters.name: verified
parameters.description: Limits to posts where the account has the verified setting matching the input.

parameters.name: weightAngry
parameters.description: How much weight to give to each type of interaction. If you send in no weights, all weights will use the current dashboard defaults. If you send in at least one weight, all other weights will default to 0. Weights are multiplied by interaction counts: e.g. weightsComment at 1 and all others at 0 will find the most commented-on posts. weightLike at 1 and weightShare at 2 will give shares twice the impact as likes when computing scores.

parameters.name: weightComment
parameters.description: How much weight to give to each type of interaction. If you send in no weights, all weights will use the current dashboard defaults. If you send in at least one weight, all other weights will default to 0. Weights are multiplied by interaction counts: e.g. weightsComment at 1 and all others at 0 will find the most commented-on posts. weightLike at 1 and weightShare at 2 will give shares twice the impact as likes when computing scores.

parameters.name: weightHaha
parameters.description: How much weight to give to each type of interaction. If you send in no weights, all weights will use the current dashboard defaults. If you send in at least one weight, all other weights will default to 0. Weights are multiplied by interaction counts: e.g. weightsComment at 1 and all others at 0 will find the most commented-on posts. weightLike at 1 and weightShare at 2 will give shares twice the impact as likes when computing scores.

parameters.description: How much weight to give to each type of interaction. If you send in no weights, all weights will use the current dashboard defaults. If you send in at least one weight, all other weights will default to 0. Weights are multiplied by interaction counts: e.g. weightsComment at 1 and all others at 0 will find the most commented-on posts. weightLike at 1 and weightShare at 2 will give shares twice the impact as likes when computing scores.

If you send in at least one weight, all other weights will default to 0. Weights are multiplied by interaction counts: e.g. weightsComment at 1 and all others at 0 will find the most commented-on posts. weightLike at 1 and weightShare at 2 will give shares twice the impact as likes when computing scores.

parameters.description: How much weight to give to each type of interaction. If you send in no weights, all weights will use the current dashboard defaults. If you send in at least one weight, all other weights will default to 0. Weights are multiplied by interaction counts: e.g. weightsComment at 1 and all others at 0 will find the most commented-on posts. weightLike at 1 and weightShare at 2 will give shares twice the impact as likes when computing scores.

parameters.name: weightSad
parameters.description: How much weight to give to each type of interaction. If you send in no weights, all weights will use the current dashboard defaults. If you send in at least one weight, all other weights will default to 0. Weights are multiplied by interaction counts: e.g. weightsComment at 1 and all others at 0 will find the most commented-on posts. weightLike at 1 and weightShare at 2 will give shares twice the impact as likes when computing scores.

parameters.name: weightShare
parameters.description: How much weight to give to each type of interaction. If you send in no weights, all weights will use the current dashboard defaults. If you send in at least one weight, all other weights will default to 0. Weights are multiplied by interaction counts: e.g. weightsComment at 1 and all others at 0 will find the most commented-on posts. weightLike at 1 and weightShare at 2 will give shares twice the impact as likes when computing scores.

parameters.name: weightUpvote
parameters.description: How much weight to give to each type of interaction. If you send in no weights, all weights will use the current dashboard defaults. If you send in at least one weight, all other weights will default to 0. Weights are multiplied by interaction counts: e.g. weightsComment at 1 and all others at 0 will find the most commented-on posts. weightLike at 1 and weightShare at 2 will give shares twice the impact as likes when computing scores.

parameters.name: weightView
parameters.description: How much weight to give to each type of interaction. If you send in no weights, all weights will use the current dashboard defaults. If you send in at least one weight, all other weights will default to 0. Weights are multiplied by interaction counts: e.g. weightsComment at 1 and all others at 0 will find the most commented-on posts. weightLike at 1 and weightShare at 2 will give shares twice the impact as likes when computing scores.

parameters.name: weightWow
parameters.description: How much weight to give to each type of interaction. If you send in no weights, all weights will use the current dashboard defaults. If you send in at least one weight, all other weights will default to 0. Weights are multiplied by interaction counts: e.g. weightsComment at 1 and all others at 0 will find the most commented-on posts. weightLike at 1 and weightShare at 2 will give shares twice the impact as likes when computing scores.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: The account handles or platform ids to search. These can be separated by commas to include multiple accounts.

parameters.name: includeHistory
parameters.description: Includes timestep data for growth of each post returned.

platformId.description: The platform's ID for the post.

platform.description: The platform on which the post was posted. E.g., Facebook, Instagram, etc.

date.description: The date and time the post was published. Time zone is UTC.

updated.description: The date and time the post was most recently updated in CrowdTangle, which is most often via getting new scores from the platform. Time zone is UTC.

message.description: The user-submitted text on a post.

expandedLinks.description: A map where the keys are the original links that came in the post (which are often shortened), and the values are the expanded links.

link.description: An external URL that the post links to, if available. (Facebook only)

postUrl.description: The URL to access the post on its platform.

subscriberCount.description: The number of subscriber the account had when the post was published. This is in contrast to the subscriberCount found on the account, which represents the current number of subscribers an account has.

score.description: The score of a post as measured by the request. E.g. it will represent the overperforming score if the request sortBy specifies overperforming, the interaction rate if the request specifies interaction_rate, etc.

media.description: An array of available media for the post.

statistics.description: Performance metrics associated with the post.

videoLengthMS.description: The length of the video in milliseconds.

liveVideoStatus.description: The status of the live video.

Id.description: The unique identifier of the post in the CrowdTangle system. This ID is specific to CrowdTangle, not the platform from which the post originated.

legacyid.description: The legacy version of the unique identifier of the post in the CrowdTangle system. This ID is specific to CrowdTangle, not the platform from which the post originated.

get.summary: Access to the Search is restricted and requires prior approval by CrowdTangle (https://www.facebook.com/help/contact/908993259530156). Retrieve a set of posts for the given parameters and search terms.

parameters.name: accounts
parameters.description: The account handles or platform ids to search. These can be separated by commas to include multiple accounts.

parameters.name: accountType
parameters.description: Limits search to a specific Facebook account type. You can use more than one type. Requires “platforms=facebook” to be set also. If “platforms=facebook” is not set, all post types including IG and Reddit will be returned. Only applies to Facebook.

parameters.name: and
parameters.description: Post search is split into OR, AND and NOT chunks. This is the AND section. Each is a phrase match, meaning that searchTerm is “CrowdTangle, API” and and is “so fast, great documentation,” it will search for ((“CrowdTangle” AND “so fast” AND “great documentation”) OR (“API” AND “so fast” AND “great documentation”)).

parameters.name: brandedContent
parameters.description: Limits to or excludes posts that have been marked as Branded Content, either as Publisher or Marketer.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of posts to return. Options: 1-100.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The latest date at which a post could be posted. Time zone is UTC. Format is “yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss” or “yyyy-mm-dd” (defaults to time 00:00:00).

parameters.name: excludePageCategories
parameters.description: Exclude one or multiple Page Categories from search results, e.g. ARTIST, TV_NETWORK, MEDIA_NEWS_COMPANY. View the full list of page categories here (https://www.facebook.com/pages/category/).

parameters.name: includeHistory
parameters.description: Includes timestep data for growth of each post returned.

parameters.name: inAccountsIds
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of the IDs of accounts to search within.

parameters.name: includeSummary
parameters.description: Adds a “summary” section with total interaction statistics for each platform that matches your search. It will look beyond the count requested to summarize across the time searched. When includeSummary is specified, either startDate or timeframe is required.

parameters.name: inListIds
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of the IDs of lists to search within.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Exceptions: Some languages require more than two characters: Chinese (Simplified) is zh-CN and Chinese (Traditional) is zh-TW.

parameters.name: minInteractions
parameters.description: If set, will exclude posts with total interactions below this threshold. Options: > 0

parameters.name: minSubscriberCount
parameters.description: The minimum number of subscribers an account must have to be included in the search results. Options: > 0

parameters.name: not
parameters.description: A corollary to “and”, “not” will exclude all posts matching this word/phrase.

parameters.name: notInAccountsIds
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of the IDs of accounts to exclude. This behaves the same as notInListIds, except with specific accounts.

parameters.name: notInListIds
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of the the IDs of lists to exclude from results. For instance, if don't want to see news outlet mentions of your search term, 'Lebron James,' you could exclude your sports publishers list.

parameters.name: notInTitle
parameters.description: Exclude all posts whose account title matches this term. E.g. search for “CrowdTangle” but ignore any accounts that include the word “CrowdTangle” to see what other accounts are posting.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of posts to offset (generally used for pagination). Pagination links will also be provided in the response. Options: > 0

parameters.name: pageAdminTopCountry
parameters.description: Limits to posts for which the account has the pageAdminTopCountry matching the parameter setting.

parameters.name: pageCategories
parameters.description: Include one or multiple Page Categories in search results, e.g. ARTIST, TV_NETWORK, MEDIA_NEWS_COMPANY. View the full list of page categories here (https://www.facebook.com/pages/category/).

parameters.name: platforms
parameters.description: The platforms from which to retrieve posts. This value can be comma-separated. Reddit is not currently available for the ACADEMICS vertical.

parameters.name: searchField
parameters.description: This allows you to search image text, URLs with query strings, and account names, in addition to text fields only or both text fields and image text.

parameters.name: searchTerm
parameters.description: Returns only posts that match this search term. Terms AND automatically. Separate with commas for OR, use quotes for phrases. E.g. CrowdTangle API -> AND. CrowdTangle, API -> OR. CrowdTangle API -> AND in that exact order. You can also use traditional Boolean search with this parameter.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: The method by which to filter and order posts.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The earliest date at which a post could be posted. Time zone is UTC. Format is “yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss” or “yyyy-mm-dd” (defaults to time 00:00:00). This must be before endDate. Timeframe and startDate are mutually exclusive; if both are passed, startDate will be preferred.

parameters.name: timeframe
parameters.description: The interval of time to consider from the endDate. Timeframe and startDate are mutually exclusive; if both are passed, startDate will be preferred. Depending on the number of posts, longer timeframes may not return within the timeout window. If you get a 504, try shortening your timeframe.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: The types of post to include. These can be separated by commas to include multiple types. If you want all live videos (whether currently or formerly live), be sure to include both live_video and live_video_complete. The "video" type does not mean all videos, it refers to videos that aren't native_video or youtube (e.g. a video on Vimeo).

parameters.name: verified
parameters.description: Limits to posts where the account has the verified setting matching the input.

parameters.name: verifiedOnly
parameters.description: Limit results to verified accounts only. Note, this only applies to platforms that supply information about verified accounts.

platformId.description: The platform's ID for the post.

platform.description: The platform on which the post was posted. E.g., Facebook, Instagram, etc.

date.description: The date and time the post was published. Time zone is UTC.

updated.description: The date and time the post was most recently updated in CrowdTangle, which is most often via getting new scores from the platform. Time zone is UTC.

description.description: Further details, if available. Associated with links or images across different platforms.

postUrl.description: The URL to access the post on its platform.

subscriberCount.description: The number of subscriber the account had when the post was published. This is in contrast to the subscriberCount found on the account, which represents the current number of subscribers an account has.

score.description: The score of a post as measured by the request. E.g. it will represent the overperforming score if the request sortBy specifies overperforming, the interaction rate if the request specifies interaction_rate, etc.

media.description: An array of available media for the post.

statistics.description: Performance metrics associated with the post.

imageText.description: The text, if it exists, within an image.

id.description: The unique identifier of the post in the CrowdTangle system. This ID is specific to CrowdTangle, not the platform from which the post originated.

get.summary: Retrieves leaderboard data for a certain list or set of accounts.

parameters.name: accountIds
parameters.description: A list of CrowdTangle accountIds to retrieve leaderboard data for. These should be provided comma-separated. This and listId are mutually exclusive; if both are sent, accountIds will be preferred.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of posts to return. Options: 1-100.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The latest date at which a post could be posted. Time zone is UTC. Format is “yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss” or “yyyy-mm-dd” (defaults to time 00:00:00).

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: The list of the leaderboard to retrieve. This and accountIds are mutually exclusive; if both are sent, accountIds will be preferred.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of posts to offset (generally used for pagination). Pagination links will also be provided in the response. Options: > 0

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: The order of the sort.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: The method by which the accountStatistics are sorted.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The startDate of the leaderboard rage. Time zone is UTC. Format is “yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss” or “yyyy-mm-dd” (defaults to time 00:00:00). This must be before endDate.

link.description: An external URL that the post links to, if available. (Facebook only)

get.summary: Retrieve a set of posts matching a certain link. This will return up to 1000 posts. This endpoint only pulls data from CrowdTangle.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of posts to return. Options: 1-100.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The latest date at which a post could be posted. Time zone is UTC. Format is “yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss” or “yyyy-mm-dd” (defaults to time 00:00:00).

parameters.name: includeHistory
parameters.description: Includes timestep data for growth of each post returned.

parameters.name: link
parameters.description: The link to query by. Required.

parameters.name: includeSummary
parameters.description: Adds a “summary” section with total interaction statistics for each platform that matches your search. It will look beyond the count requested to summarize across the time searched. When includeSummary is specified, either startDate or timeframe is required.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of posts to offset (generally used for pagination). Pagination links will also be provided in the response. Options: > 0

parameters.name: platforms
parameters.description: The platforms from which to retrieve posts. This value can be comma-separated. Reddit is not currently available for the ACADEMICS vertical.

parameters.name: searchField
parameters.description: Allows you to search URLs containing query strings.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The startDate of the leaderboard rage. Time zone is UTC. Format is “yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss” or “yyyy-mm-dd” (defaults to time 00:00:00). This must be before endDate.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: The method by which to order posts (defaults to the most recent). If subscriber_count, a startDate is required.

brandedContentSponsor.description: See account. This field is only present for Facebook Page posts where there is a sponsoring Page.

caption.description: The caption to a photo, if available.

date.description: The date and time the post was published. Time zone is UTC.

description.description: Further details, if available. Associated with links or images across different platforms.

expandedLinks.description: A map where the keys are the original links that came in the post (which are often shortened), and the values are the expanded links.

id.description: The unique identifier of the post in the CrowdTangle system. This ID is specific to CrowdTangle, not the platform from which the post originated.

imageText.description: The text, if it exists, within an image.

legacyid.description: The legacy version of the unique identifier of the post in the CrowdTangle system. This ID is specific to CrowdTangle, not the platform from which the post originated.

link.description: An external URL that the post links to, if available. (Facebook only)

media.description: An array of available media for the post.

message.description: The user-submitted text on a post.

platform.description: The platform on which the post was posted. E.g., Facebook, Instagram, etc.

platformId.description: The platform's ID for the post.

postUrl.description: The URL to access the post on its platform.

score.description: The score of a post as measured by the request. E.g. it will represent the overperforming score if the request sortBy specifies overperforming, the interaction rate if the request specifies interaction_rate, etc.

statistics.description: Performance metrics associated with the post.

subscriberCount.description: The number of subscriber the account had when the post was published. This is in contrast to the subscriberCount found on the account, which represents the current number of subscribers an account has.

updated.description: The date and time the post was most recently updated in CrowdTangle, which is most often via getting new scores from the platform. Time zone is UTC.

videoLengthMS.description: The length of the video in milliseconds.

liveVideoStatus.description: The status of the live video.

get.summary: Retrieve the lists, saved searches and saved post lists of the dashboard associated with the token sent in.

id.description: The unique identifier of the post in the CrowdTangle system. This ID is specific to CrowdTangle, not the platform from which the post originated.

get.summary: Retrieve the accounts for a given list. Accounts may only be retrieved for lists of type LIST, as saved searches and saved posts do not have associated accounts.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of posts to return. Options: 1-100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of posts to offset (generally used for pagination). Pagination links will also be provided in the response. Options: >= 0

id.description: The unique identifier of the post in the CrowdTangle system. This ID is specific to CrowdTangle, not the platform from which the post originated.

subscriberCount.description: The number of subscriber the account had when the post was published. This is in contrast to the subscriberCount found on the account, which represents the current number of subscribers an account has.

platform.description: The platform on which the post was posted. E.g., Facebook, Instagram, etc.

platformId.description: The platform's ID for the post.

brandedContentSponsor.description: See account. This field is only present for Facebook Page posts where there is a sponsoring Page.

caption.description: The caption to a photo, if available.

date.description: The date and time the post was published. Time zone is UTC.

description.description: Further details, if available. Associated with links or images across different platforms.

expandedLinks.description: A map where the keys are the original links that came in the post (which are often shortened), and the values are the expanded links.

id.description: The unique identifier of the post in the CrowdTangle system. This ID is specific to CrowdTangle, not the platform from which the post originated.

imageText.description: The text, if it exists, within an image.

legacyid.description: The legacy version of the unique identifier of the post in the CrowdTangle system. This ID is specific to CrowdTangle, not the platform from which the post originated.

link.description: An external URL that the post links to, if available. (Facebook only)

media.description: An array of available media for the post.

message.description: The user-submitted text on a post.

platform.description: The platform on which the post was posted. E.g., Facebook, Instagram, etc.

platformId.description: The platform's ID for the post.

postUrl.description: The URL to access the post on its platform.

score.description: The score of a post as measured by the request. E.g. it will represent the overperforming score if the request sortBy specifies overperforming, the interaction rate if the request specifies interaction_rate, etc.

statistics.description: Performance metrics associated with the post.

subscriberCount.description: The number of subscriber the account had when the post was published. This is in contrast to the subscriberCount found on the account, which represents the current number of subscribers an account has.

updated.description: The date and time the post was most recently updated in CrowdTangle, which is most often via getting new scores from the platform. Time zone is UTC.

videoLengthMS.description: The length of the video in milliseconds.

liveVideoStatus.description: The status of the live video.
